  859: 	 {{0,0,0,0},"0.0"},
  860: 	 {{0,0,0,0},"00.00.00"},
  861: 	 {{0,0,0,0},"0.00.0.0"},
  862: 	 {{0,0,0,0},"0.0.000000000000.0"}],
  863:     V6Sloppy =
  864:         [{{16#a,16#b,16#c,16#0,16#0,16#d,16#e,16#f},"A:B:C::d:e:f"},
  865:          {{16#fe80,0,0,0,0,0,0,16#12},"fe80::12%XXXXXXX"}]
  866:         ++
  867:         [{{P,0,0,0,0,D2,(D1 bsl 8) bor D2,(D3 bsl 8) bor D4},
  868:           Q++erlang:integer_to_list(D2, 16)++":"++S}
  869:          || {{D1,D2,D3,D4},S} <- V4Reversable,
  870:             {P,Q} <-
  871:                 [{16#2001,"2001::"},{16#177,"177::"},{16#ff0,"Ff0::"}]],
  872:     V4Err =
  873: 	["0.256.0.1",
  874: 	 "1.2.3.4.5",
  875: 	 "256.255.65535",
  876: 	 "4294967296",
  877: 	 "0x100000000",
  878: 	 "040000000000",
  879: 	 "1.2.3.-4",
  880: 	 "1.2.-3.4",
  881: 	 "1.-2.3.4",
  882: 	 "-1.2.3.4",
  883: 	 "10.",
  884: 	 "172.16.",
  885: 	 "198.168.0.",
  886: 	 "127.0.0.1."],
  887:     V6Err =
  888: 	[":::",
  889: 	 "f:::2",
  890: 	 "::-1",
  891: 	 "::g",
  892: 	 "f:f11::10100:2",
  893: 	 "f:f11::01100:2",
  894: 	 "::17000",
  895: 	 "::01700",
  896: 	 "10000::",
  897: 	 "01000::",
  898: 	 "::8:7:6:5:4:3:2:1",
  899: 	 "8:7:6:5:4:3:2:1::",
  900: 	 "8:7:6:5:4::3:2:1",
  901: 	 "::1.2.3.4.5",
  902: 	 "::1.2.3.04",
  903: 	 "::1.256.3.4",
  904: 	 "::-5.4.3.2",
  905: 	 "::5.-4.3.2",
  906: 	 "::5.4.-3.2",
  907: 	 "::5.4.3.-2",
  908: 	 "::FFFF:1.2.3.4.5",
  909: 	 "::10.",
  910: 	 "::FFFF:172.16.",
  911: 	 "fe80::198.168.0.",
  912: 	 "fec0::fFfF:127.0.0.1."],
  913:     t_parse_address
  914:       (parse_ipv6_address,
  915:        false,
  916:        V6Reversable++V6Sloppy++V6Err++V4Err),
  917:     t_parse_address
  918:       (parse_ipv6strict_address,
  919:        true,
  920:        V6Reversable++V6Err++V4Err),
  921:     t_parse_address
  922:       (parse_ipv4_address,
  923:        false,
  924:        V4Reversable++V4Sloppy++V4Err++V6Err++[S || {_,S} <- V6Reversable]),
  925:     t_parse_address
  926:       (parse_ipv4strict_address,
  927:        true,
  928:        V4Reversable++V4Err++V6Err++[S || {_,S} <- V4Sloppy++V6Reversable]).
  929: 
  930: t_parse_address(Func, _Reversable, []) ->
  931:     io:format("~p done.~n", [Func]),
  932:     ok;
  933: t_parse_address(Func, Reversible, [{Addr,String}|L]) ->
  934:     io:format("~p = ~p.~n", [Addr,String]),
  935:     {ok,Addr} = inet:Func(String),
  936:     case Reversible of
  937:         true ->String = inet:ntoa(Addr);
  938:         false -> ok
  939:     end,
  940:     t_parse_address(Func, Reversible, L);
  941: t_parse_address(Func, Reversible, [String|L]) ->
  942:     io:format("~p.~n", [String]),
  943:     {error,einval} = inet:Func(String),
  944:     t_parse_address(Func, Reversible, L).
  945: 
  946: parse_strict_address(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  947:     {ok, {127,0,0,1}} =
  948: 	inet:parse_strict_address("127.0.0.1"),
  949:     {ok, {3089,3106,23603,50240,21952,50796,119,136}} =
  950: 	inet:parse_strict_address("c11:0c22:5c33:c440:55c0:c66c:77:0088"),
  951:     {ok, {3089,3106,23603,50240,0,0,119,136}} =
  952: 	inet:parse_strict_address("c11:0c22:5c33:c440::077:0088").
  953: 
  954: is_ip_address(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  955:     IPv4Addresses = [
  956:         {0, 0, 0, 0},
  957:         {255, 255, 255, 255}
  958:     ],
  959:     IPv6Addresses = [
  960:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  961:         {16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff}
  962:     ],
  963:     NonIPAddresses = [
  964:         foo,
  965:         "0.0.0.0",
  966:         {},
  967:         {0},
  968:         {0, 0},
  969:         {0, 0, 0},
  970:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  971:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  972:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  973:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  974:         {0, 0, 0, foo},
  975:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, foo},
  976:         {0, 0, 0, 256},
  977:         {0, 0, 256, 0},
  978:         {0, 256, 0, 0},
  979:         {256, 0, 0, 0},
  980:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 16#10000},
  981:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 16#10000, 0},
  982:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 16#10000, 0, 0},
  983:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 16#10000, 0, 0, 0},
  984:         {0, 0, 0, 16#10000, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  985:         {0, 0, 16#10000, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  986:         {0, 16#10000, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  987:         {16#10000, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  988:         {0, 0, 0, -1},
  989:         {0, 0, -1, 0},
  990:         {0, -1, 0, 0},
  991:         {-1, 0, 0, 0},
  992:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, -1},
  993:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, -1, 0},
  994:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, -1, 0, 0},
  995:         {0, 0, 0, 0, -1, 0, 0, 0},
  996:         {0, 0, 0, -1, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  997:         {0, 0, -1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  998:         {0, -1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  999:         {-1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0}
 1000:     ],
 1001: 
 1002:     true = lists:all(fun inet:is_ipv4_address/1, IPv4Addresses),
 1003:     false = lists:any(fun inet:is_ipv4_address/1, IPv6Addresses ++ NonIPAddresses),
 1004: 
 1005:     true = lists:all(fun inet:is_ipv6_address/1, IPv6Addresses),
 1006:     false = lists:any(fun inet:is_ipv6_address/1, IPv4Addresses ++ NonIPAddresses),
 1007: 
 1008:     true = lists:all(fun inet:is_ip_address/1, IPv6Addresses ++ IPv4Addresses),
 1009:     false = lists:any(fun inet:is_ip_address/1, NonIPAddresses).
 1010: 
 1011: ipv4_mapped_ipv6_address(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1012:     {D1,D2,D3,D4} = IPv4Address =
 1013:         {rand:uniform(256) - 1,
 1014:          rand:uniform(256) - 1,
 1015:          rand:uniform(256) - 1,
 1016:          rand:uniform(256) - 1},
 1017:     E7 = (D1 bsl 8) bor D2,
 1018:     E8 = (D3 bsl 8) bor D4,
 1019:     io:format("IPv4Address: ~p.~n", [IPv4Address]),
 1020:     {0,0,0,0,0,65535,E7,E8} = inet:ipv4_mapped_ipv6_address(IPv4Address),
 1021:     IPv6Address =
 1022:         {rand:uniform(65536) - 1,
 1023:          rand:uniform(65536) - 1,
 1024:          rand:uniform(65536) - 1,
 1025:          rand:uniform(65536) - 1,
 1026:          rand:uniform(65536) - 1,
 1027:          rand:uniform(65536) - 1, E7, E8},
 1028:     IPv4Address = inet:ipv4_mapped_ipv6_address(IPv6Address),
 1029:     ok.
 1030: 
 1031: 
 1032: ntoa(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1033:     M8 = 1 bsl 8,
 1034:     M16 = 1 bsl 16,
 1035:     V4Xs = rand_tuple(4, M8),
 1036:     V6Xs = rand_tuple(4, M16),
 1037:     ntoa(
 1038:       [{A, B, C, D} ||
 1039:           A <- [0, element(1, V4Xs), M8-1, -1, 256],
 1040:           B <- [0, element(2, V4Xs), M8-1, -1, 256],
 1041:           C <- [0, element(3, V4Xs), M8-1, -1, 256],
 1042:           D <- [0, element(4, V4Xs), M8-1, -1, 256]], M8-1),
 1043:     ntoa(
 1044:       [{E, F, G, H, G, G, E, F} ||
 1045:           E <- [0, element(1, V6Xs), M16-1, -1, M16],
 1046:           F <- [0, element(2, V6Xs), M16-1, -1, M16],
 1047:           G <- [0, element(3, V6Xs), M16-1, -1, M16],
 1048:           H <- [0, element(4, V6Xs), M16-1, -1, M16]], M16-1).
 1049: 
 1050: ntoa([A | As], Max) ->
 1051:     case
 1052:         lists:all(
 1053:           fun (X) when 0 =< X, X =< Max -> true;
 1054:               (_) -> false
 1055:           end, tuple_to_list(A))
 1056:     of
 1057:         true ->
 1058:             S = inet:ntoa(A),
 1059:             {ok, A} = inet:parse_address(S);
 1060:         false ->
 1061:             {error, einval} = inet:ntoa(A)
 1062:     end,
 1063:     ntoa(As, Max);
 1064: ntoa([], _Max) ->
 1065:     ok.
 1066: 
 1067: rand_tuple(N, M) ->
 1068:     rand_tuple(N, M, []).
 1069: %%
 1070: rand_tuple(0, _M, Acc) ->
 1071:     list_to_tuple(Acc);
 1072: rand_tuple(N, M, Acc) ->
 1073:     rand_tuple(N - 1, M, [rand:uniform(M) - 1 | Acc]).
 1074: 
 1075: 
 1076: t_gethostnative(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1077:     %% this will result in 26 bytes sent which causes problem in Windows
 1078:     %% if the port-program has not assured stdin to be read in BINARY mode
 1079:     %% OTP-2555
 1080:     case inet_gethost_native:gethostbyname(
 1081: 	   "a23456789012345678901234") of
 1082: 	{error,notfound} ->
 1083: 	    ok;
 1084: 	{error,no_data} ->
 1085: 	    ok;
 1086: 	{error,try_again} ->
 1087: 	    ok
 1088:     end.
 1089: 
 1090: %% Check that the emulator survives crashes in gethost_native.
 1091: gethostnative_parallell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1092:     {ok,Hostname} = inet:gethostname(),
 1093:     {ok,_} = inet:gethostbyname(Hostname),
 1094:     case whereis(inet_gethost_native) of
 1095: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1096: 	    do_gethostnative_parallell();
 1097: 	_ ->
 1098: 	    {skipped, "Not running native gethostbyname"}
 1099:     end.
 1100: 
 1101: do_gethostnative_parallell() ->
 1102:     {ok,Peer,Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1103:     ok = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, parallell_gethost, []),
 1104:     receive after 10000 -> ok end,
 1105:     pong = net_adm:ping(Node),
 1106:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1107:     ok.
 1108: 
 1109: parallell_gethost() ->
 1110:     {ok,Hostname} = inet:gethostname(),
 1111:     process_flag(trap_exit,true),
 1112:     parallell_gethost_loop(10, Hostname).
 1113: 
 1114: parallell_gethost_loop(0, _) -> ok;
 1115: parallell_gethost_loop(N, Hostname) ->
 1116:     case whereis(inet_gethost_native) of
 1117: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1118: 	    true = exit(Pid,kill);
 1119: 	_ ->
 1120: 	    ok
 1121:     end,
 1122: 
 1123:     L = spawn_gethosters(Hostname, 10),
 1124:     release_gethosters(L),
 1125:     collect_gethosters(10),
 1126:     parallell_gethost_loop(N-1, Hostname).
 1127: 
 1128: spawn_gethosters(_, 0) ->
 1129:     [];
 1130: spawn_gethosters(Hostname, N) ->
 1131:     Collector = self(),
 1132:     [spawn(fun() ->
 1133: 		   receive 
 1134: 		       go ->
 1135: 			   case (catch inet:gethostbyname(Hostname)) of
 1136: 			       {ok,_} ->
 1137: 				   Collector ! ok;
 1138: 			       Else ->
 1139: 				   Collector ! {error,Else}
 1140: 			   end
 1141: 		   end 
 1142: 	   end) | 
 1143:      spawn_gethosters(Hostname, N-1)].
 1144: 
 1145: release_gethosters([]) ->
 1146:     ok;
 1147: release_gethosters([H|T]) ->
 1148:     H ! go,
 1149:     release_gethosters(T).
 1150: 
 1151: collect_gethosters(0) ->
 1152:     ok;
 1153: collect_gethosters(N) ->
 1154:     receive
 1155: 	ok ->
 1156: 	    collect_gethosters(N-1);
 1157: 	Else ->
 1158: 	    {failed, {unexpected, Else}}
 1159:     after 2000 ->
 1160: 	    {failed, {missing, N}}
 1161:     end.
 1162: 
 1163: kill_gethost() ->
 1164:     kill_gethost(20).
 1165: 
 1166: kill_gethost(0) ->
 1167:     ok;
 1168: kill_gethost(N) ->
 1169:     put(kill_gethost_n,N),
 1170:     Pid = wait_for_gethost(10),
 1171:     true = exit(Pid,kill),
 1172:     wait_for_dead_gethost(10),
 1173:     kill_gethost(N-1).
 1174: 
 1175: wait_for_dead_gethost(0) ->
 1176:     exit({not_dead,inet_gethost_native});
 1177: wait_for_dead_gethost(N) ->
 1178:     case whereis(inet_gethost_native) of
 1179: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1180: 	    receive after 1000 ->
 1181: 			    ok
 1182: 		    end,
 1183: 	    wait_for_dead_gethost(N-1);
 1184: 	undefined ->
 1185: 	    ok
 1186:     end.
 1187: 
 1188: wait_for_gethost(0) ->
 1189:     exit(gethost_not_found);
 1190: wait_for_gethost(N) ->
 1191:     {ok,Hostname} = inet:gethostname(),
 1192:     case (catch inet:gethostbyname(Hostname)) of
 1193: 	{ok,_} ->
 1194: 	    ok;
 1195: 	Otherwise ->
 1196: 	    %% This is what I call an exit tuple :)
 1197: 	    exit({inet,gethostbyname, returned, Otherwise, 'when',
 1198: 		  'N','=',N,'and','hostname','=',Hostname,'and',
 1199: 		  kill_gethost_n,'=',get(kill_gethost_n)})
 1200:     end,
 1201:     case whereis(inet_gethost_native) of
 1202: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1203: 	    Pid;
 1204: 	_ ->
 1205: 	    receive
 1206: 	    after 1000 ->
 1207: 		    ok
 1208: 	    end,
 1209: 	    wait_for_gethost(N-1)
 1210:     end.
 1211: 
 1212: %% Check that the resolver handles a CNAME loop.
 1213: cname_loop(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1214:     %% getbyname (hostent_by_domain)
 1215:     ok = inet_db:add_rr("mydomain.com", in, ?S_CNAME, ttl, "mydomain.com"),
 1216:     {error,nxdomain} = inet_db:getbyname("mydomain.com", ?S_A),
 1217:     ok = inet_db:del_rr("mydomain.com", in, ?S_CNAME, "mydomain.com"),
 1218:     %% res_hostent_by_domain
 1219:     RR = #dns_rr{domain = "mydomain.com",
 1220: 		 class = in,
 1221: 		 type = ?S_CNAME,
 1222: 		 data = "mydomain.com"},
 1223:     Rec = #dns_rec{anlist = [RR]},
 1224:     {error,nxdomain} = inet_db:res_hostent_by_domain("mydomain.com", ?S_A, Rec),
 1225:     ok.
 1226: 
 1227: 
 1228: %% Test that hosts file gets reloaded correctly in case when it
 1229: % was missing during initial startup
 1230: missing_hosts_reload(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1231:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1232:     HostsFile = filename:join(RootDir, atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ ".hosts"),
 1233:     InetRc = filename:join(RootDir, "inetrc"),
 1234:     ok = file:write_file(InetRc, "{hosts_file, \"" ++ HostsFile ++ "\"}.\n"),
 1235:     {error, enoent} = file:read_file_info(HostsFile),
 1236:     % start a node
 1237:     {ok, Peer, TestNode} = ?CT_PEER(["-kernel", "inetrc", "\"" ++ InetRc ++ "\""]),
 1238:     % ensure it has our RC
 1239:     Rc = rpc:call(TestNode, inet_db, get_rc, []),
 1240:     {hosts_file, HostsFile} = lists:keyfind(hosts_file, 1, Rc),
 1241:     % ensure it does not resolve
 1242:     {error, nxdomain} = rpc:call(TestNode, inet_hosts, gethostbyname, ["somehost"]),
 1243:     % write hosts file
 1244:     ok = file:write_file(HostsFile, "1.2.3.4 somehost"),
 1245:     % wait for cached timestamp to expire
 1246:     timer:sleep(?RES_FILE_UPDATE_TM * 1000 + 100),
 1247:     % ensure it DOES resolve
 1248:     {ok,{hostent,"somehost",[],inet,4,[{1,2,3,4}]}} =
 1249:         rpc:call(TestNode, inet_hosts, gethostbyname, ["somehost"]),
 1250:     % cleanup
 1251:     peer:stop(Peer).
 1252: 
 1253: 
 1254: %% The /etc/hosts file format and limitations is quite undocumented.
 1255: %%
 1256: %% Our implementation of the hosts file resolver tries to
 1257: %% do the right thing.  Here is an attempt to define "the right thing",
 1258: %% and this test case tries to check most of these rules:
 1259: %%
 1260: %% * A hosts file consists of entries with one IP address,
 1261: %%   and a list of host names.  The IP address is IPv4 or IPv6.
 1262: %%   The first host name is the primary host name
 1263: %%   and the others are aliases.
 1264: %%
 1265: %% * A lookup for an IP address should return one #hostent{} record
 1266: %%   with the one IP address from the query, and the host names
 1267: %%   from all entries with the same IP address concatenated.
 1268: %%   The first host name from the first hosts file entry
 1269: %%   with the requested IP address will be the primary host name
 1270: %%   and all others are aliases.  All host names are returned
 1271: %%   as in the hosts file entries i.e character case is preserved.
 1272: %%
 1273: %% * A lookup for a host name is character case insensitive.
 1274: %%
 1275: %% * A lookup for a host name should return one #hostent{} record
 1276: %%   with the host name list from the first hosts file entry
 1277: %%   with an IP address of the requested address family
 1278: %%   that has a matching host name, as it is in the hosts file
 1279: %%   i.e character case is preserved.  The IP addresses in the
 1280: %%   returned #hostent{} record should be the first from the
 1281: %%   same matching hosts file entry, followed by all others
 1282: %%   for which there is a matching host name and address family.
 1283: %%   There should be no duplicates among the returned IP addresses.
 1284: %%
 1285: %% * These rules are of the opinion that if duplicate host names
 1286: %%   with the same character casing occurs for the same IP
 1287: %%   address, it is a configuration error, so it is not tested for
 1288: %%   and there is no preferred behaviour.
 1289: hosts_file_quirks(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1290:     Records = [R1, R2, R3, R4, R5] =
 1291:         [#hostent{
 1292:             h_name = h_ex(Name),
 1293:             h_aliases = [h_ex(Alias) || Alias <- Aliases],
 1294:             h_addrtype = Fam,
 1295:             h_length =
 1296:                 case Fam of
 1297:                     inet -> 4;
 1298:                     inet6 -> 16
 1299:                 end,
 1300:             h_addr_list =
 1301:                 [case Fam of
 1302:                      inet -> inet_ex(N);
 1303:                      inet6 -> inet6_ex(N)
 1304:                  end]}
 1305:          || {{Fam,N}, Name, Aliases} <-
 1306:                 [{{inet,1}, "a", ["B"]},
 1307:                  {{inet,2}, "D", []},
 1308:                  {{inet6,3}, "A", ["c"]},
 1309:                  {{inet,1}, "c", []},
 1310:                  {{inet,5}, "A", []}]],
 1311:     true = R1#hostent.h_addr_list =:= R4#hostent.h_addr_list,
 1312:     R14 =
 1313:         R1#hostent{
 1314:           h_aliases =
 1315:               R1#hostent.h_aliases ++
 1316:               [R4#hostent.h_name | R4#hostent.h_aliases]},
 1317:     R145 =
 1318:         R14#hostent{
 1319:           h_addr_list =
 1320:               R1#hostent.h_addr_list ++ R5#hostent.h_addr_list},
 1321:     %%
 1322:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1323:     HostsFile = filename:join(RootDir, atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "-quirks.hosts"),
 1324:     InetRc = filename:join(RootDir, "quirks.inetrc"),
 1325:     ok = file:write_file(HostsFile, hostents_to_list(Records)),
 1326:     ok = file:write_file(InetRc, "{hosts_file, \"" ++ HostsFile ++ "\"}.\n"),
 1327:     %%
 1328:     %% start a node
 1329:     {ok, Peer, TestNode} = ?CT_PEER(["-kernel", "inetrc", "\"" ++ InetRc ++ "\""]),
 1330:     %% ensure it has our RC
 1331:     Rc = rpc:call(TestNode, inet_db, get_rc, []),
 1332:     {hosts_file, HostsFile} = lists:keyfind(hosts_file, 1, Rc),
 1333:     false = lists:keyfind(host, 1, Rc),
 1334:     %%
 1335:     %% check entries
 1336:     io:format("Check hosts file contents~n", []),
 1337:     V1 =
 1338:       [{R14, inet_ex(1)},
 1339:        {R2, inet_ex(2)},
 1340:        {R3, inet6_ex(3)},
 1341:        {R5, inet_ex(5)},
 1342:        {R145, h_ex("a"), inet},
 1343:        {R14, h_ex("b"), inet},
 1344:        {R14, h_ex("c"), inet},
 1345:        {R2, h_ex("d"), inet},
 1346:        {R3, h_ex("a"), inet6},
 1347:        {R3, h_ex("c"), inet6}
 1348:       ],
 1349:     hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, V1),
 1350:     %%
 1351:     %% test add and del
 1352:     A1 = inet_ex(1),
 1353:     Hs1 = [h_ex("a"), h_ex("B")],
 1354:     ok = rpc:call(TestNode, inet_db, add_host, [A1, Hs1]),
 1355:     io:format("Check after add host~n", []),
 1356:     hosts_file_quirks_verify(
 1357:       TestNode,
 1358:       [{R1, A1},
 1359:        {R2, inet_ex(2)},
 1360:        {R3, inet6_ex(3)},
 1361:        {R5, inet_ex(5)},
 1362:        {R1, h_ex("a"), inet},
 1363:        {R1, h_ex("b"), inet},
 1364:        {R14, h_ex("c"), inet},
 1365:        {R2, h_ex("d"), inet},
 1366:        {R3, h_ex("a"), inet6},
 1367:        {R3, h_ex("c"), inet6}
 1368:       ]),
 1369:     {host, A1, Hs1} =
 1370:         lists:keyfind(host, 1, rpc:call(TestNode, inet_db, get_rc, [])),
 1371:     ok = rpc:call(TestNode, inet_db, del_host, [inet_ex(1)]),
 1372:     io:format("Check after del host~n", []),
 1373:     hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, V1),
 1374:     %%
 1375:     %% cleanup
 1376:     peer:stop(Peer).
 1377: 
 1378: hosts_file_quirks_verify(_TestNode, Vs) ->
 1379:     hosts_file_quirks_verify(_TestNode, Vs, true).
 1380: %%
 1381: hosts_file_quirks_verify(_TestNode, [], Ok) ->
 1382:     case Ok of
 1383:         true -> ok;
 1384:         false -> error(verify_failed)
 1385:     end;
 1386: hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, [V | Vs], Ok) ->
 1387:     case
 1388:         case V of
 1389:             {R, Addr} ->
 1390:                 {R, rpc:call(TestNode, inet_hosts, gethostbyaddr, [Addr])};
 1391:             {R, Host, Fam} ->
 1392:                 {R, rpc:call(TestNode, inet_hosts, gethostbyname, [Host, Fam])}
 1393:         end
 1394:     of
 1395:         {nxdomain, {error, nxdomain}} ->
 1396:             hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, Vs, Ok);
 1397:         {_R_1, {error, nxdomain}} ->
 1398:             io:format("Verify failed ~p: nxdomain~n", [V]),
 1399:             hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, Vs, false);
 1400:         {R_1, {ok, R_1}} ->
 1401:             hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, Vs, Ok);
 1402:         {_R_1, {ok, R_2}} ->
 1403:             io:format("Verify failed ~p: ~p~n", [V, R_2]),
 1404:             hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, Vs, false)
 1405:     end.
 1406: 
 1407: %% Expand entry
 1408: h_ex(H) -> H ++ ".example.com".
 1409: inet_ex(N) -> {127,17,17,N}.
 1410: inet6_ex(N) -> {0,0,0,0,17,17,17,N}.
 1411: 
 1412: hostents_to_list([]) -> [];
 1413: hostents_to_list([R | Rs]) ->
 1414:     #hostent{
 1415:        h_name = Name,
 1416:        h_aliases = Aliases,
 1417:        h_addr_list = [IP]} = R,
 1418:     [inet:ntoa(IP), $\t,
 1419:      lists:join($\s, [Name | Aliases]), $\r, $\n
 1420:      | hostents_to_list(Rs)].
 1421: 
 1422: 
 1423: %% These must be run in the whole suite since they need
 1424: %% the host list and require inet_gethost_native to be started.
 1425: %%
 1426: -record(gethostnative_control, {control_seq,
 1427: 				control_interval = 100,
 1428: 				lookup_delay     = 10,
 1429: 				lookup_count     = 300,
 1430: 				lookup_processes = 20}).
 1431: 
 1432: gethostnative_soft_restart() -> required(hosts).
 1433: 
 1434: %% Check that no name lookups fails during soft restart
 1435: %% of inet_gethost_native.
 1436: gethostnative_soft_restart(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1437:     Opts  = gethostnative_adjusted_opts(Config,
 1438:                                         [soft_restart]),
 1439:     gethostnative_control(Config, Opts).
 1440: 
 1441: gethostnative_debug_level() -> required(hosts).
 1442: 
 1443: %% Check that no name lookups fails during debug level change
 1444: %% of inet_gethost_native.
 1445: gethostnative_debug_level(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1446:     Opts  = gethostnative_adjusted_opts(Config,
 1447:                                         [{debug_level, 1},
 1448:                                          {debug_level, 0}]),
 1449:     gethostnative_control(Config, Opts).
 1450: 
 1451: gethostnative_adjusted_opts(Config, CtrlSeq) ->
 1452:     Factor = ?config(kernel_factor, Config),
 1453:     gethostnative_adjusted_opts2(Factor, CtrlSeq).
 1454: 
 1455: gethostnative_adjusted_opts2(1, CtrlSeq) ->
 1456:     #gethostnative_control{control_seq = CtrlSeq};
 1457: gethostnative_adjusted_opts2(F, CtrlSeq) ->
 1458:     Opts = #gethostnative_control{control_seq = CtrlSeq},
 1459:     gethostnative_adjusted_opts3(F, Opts).
 1460: 
 1461: gethostnative_adjusted_opts3(
 1462:   F,
 1463:   #gethostnative_control{lookup_count     = Cnt,
 1464:                          lookup_processes = NProc} = Opts) ->
 1465:     Adjust = fun(X) ->
 1466:                      if
 1467:                          F > 10 ->
 1468:                              X div 4;
 1469:                          F > 5 ->
 1470:                              X div 3;
 1471:                          F > 2 -> 
 1472:                              (2 * X) div 3;
 1473:                          true ->
 1474:                              X
 1475:                      end
 1476:              end,
 1477:     Opts#gethostnative_control{lookup_count     = Adjust(Cnt),
 1478:                                lookup_processes = Adjust(NProc)}.
 1479: 
 1480: 
 1481: gethostnative_control(Config, Opts) ->
 1482:     case inet_db:res_option(lookup) of
 1483: 	[native] ->
 1484: 	    case whereis(inet_gethost_native) of
 1485: 		Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1486: 		    gethostnative_control_1(Config, Opts);
 1487: 		_ ->
 1488: 		    {skipped, "Not running native gethostbyname"}
 1489: 	    end;
 1490: 	_ ->
 1491: 	    {skipped, "Native not only lookup method"}
 1492:     end.
 1493: 
 1494: gethostnative_control_1(
 1495:   Config,
 1496:   #gethostnative_control{control_seq      = Seq,
 1497:                          control_interval = Interval,
 1498:                          lookup_delay     = Delay,
 1499:                          lookup_count     = Cnt,
 1500:                          lookup_processes = N}) ->
 1501:     ?P("gethostnative control -> begin with"
 1502:        "~n      Ctrl Seq:      ~p"
 1503:        "~n      Ctrl interval: ~p"
 1504:        "~n      Lookup delay:  ~p"
 1505:        "~n      Lookup count:  ~p"
 1506:        "~n      Lookup procs:  ~p", [Seq, Interval, Delay, Cnt, N]),
 1507:     {ok, Hostname} = inet:gethostname(),
 1508:     {ok, _}        = inet:gethostbyname(Hostname),
 1509:     Hosts          =
 1510:         [Hostname|[H || {_,H} <- get_hosts(Config)]
 1511:          ++[H++D || H <- ["www.","www1.","www2.",""],
 1512:         	    D <- ["erlang.org","erlang.se"]]
 1513:          ++[H++"cslab.ericsson.net" || H <- ["morgoth.","hades.","styx."]]],
 1514:     ?P("ctrl-1: Hosts: "
 1515:        "~n   ~p", [Hosts]),
 1516:     %% Spawn some processes to do parallel lookups while
 1517:     %% I repeatedly do inet_gethost_native:control/1.
 1518:     TrapExit = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1519:     gethostnative_control_2([undefined], Interval, Delay, Cnt, N, Hosts),
 1520:     erlang:display(first_intermission),
 1521:     ?P("ctrl-1: First intermission: "
 1522:        "~n   Now starting control sequence ~p", [Seq]),
 1523:     gethostnative_control_2(Seq, Interval, Delay, Cnt, N, Hosts),
 1524:     erlang:display(second_intermission),
 1525:     ?P("ctrl-1: Second intermission: "
 1526:        "~n   Now stopping control sequence ~p", [Seq]),
 1527:     gethostnative_control_2([undefined], Interval, Delay, Cnt, N, Hosts),
 1528:     true = process_flag(trap_exit, TrapExit),
 1529:     ?P("control-1: done"),
 1530:     ok.
 1531: 
 1532: gethostnative_control_2(Seq, Interval, Delay, Cnt, N, Hosts) ->
 1533:     Tag       = make_ref(),
 1534:     Parent    = self(),
 1535:     Lookup    = fun() ->
 1536:                         ?P("lookuper starting"),
 1537:                         lookup_loop(Hosts, Delay, Tag, Parent, Cnt, Hosts) 
 1538:                 end,
 1539:     Lookupers = [spawn_link(Lookup) || _ <- lists:seq(1, N)],
 1540:     control_loop(Seq, Interval, Tag, Lookupers, Seq),
 1541:     gethostnative_control_3(Tag, ok).
 1542: 
 1543: gethostnative_control_3(Tag, Reason) ->
 1544:     receive
 1545: 	{Tag, Lookuper, Error} ->
 1546:             ?P("control-3: received lookup error from ~p: ~p",
 1547:                [Lookuper, Error]),
 1548: 	    gethostnative_control_3(Tag, Error)
 1549:     after 0 ->
 1550:             ?P("control-3: no (more) lookup errors"),
 1551: 	    Reason
 1552:     end.
 1553: 
 1554: control_loop([], _Interval, _Tag, [], _Seq) ->
 1555:     ok;
 1556: control_loop([], Interval, Tag, Lookupers, Seq) ->
 1557:     control_loop(Seq, Interval, Tag, Lookupers, Seq);
 1558: control_loop([Op|Ops], Interval, Tag, Lookupers, Seq) ->
 1559:     control_loop(Ops, Interval, Tag, 
 1560: 		 control_loop_1(Op, Interval, Tag, Lookupers),
 1561: 		 Seq).
 1562: 
 1563: control_loop_1(Op, Interval, Tag, Lookupers) ->
 1564:     ?P("ctrl-loop-1: await lookuper exit"),
 1565:     receive
 1566:         {'EXIT', _Pid, {timetrap_timeout, _, _}} ->
 1567:             ?P("ctrl-loop-1: "
 1568:                "timetrap timeout while ~w lookupers remaining: "
 1569:                "~n   Op:       ~p"
 1570:                "~n   Interval: ~p"
 1571:                "~n   Tag:      ~p",
 1572:                [length(Lookupers), Op, Interval, Tag]),
 1573:             if
 1574:                 (Op =/= undefined) ->
 1575:                     exit({timetrap, {Op, Tag, length(Lookupers)}});
 1576:                 true ->
 1577:                     exit({timetrap, {Tag, length(Lookupers)}})
 1578:             end;
 1579: 
 1580: 	{'EXIT', Pid, Reason} ->
 1581: 	    case Reason of
 1582: 		Tag -> % Done
 1583:                     ?P("ctrl-loop-1: "
 1584:                        "received expected exit from lookuper ~p", [Pid]),
 1585: 		    control_loop_1
 1586: 		      (Op, Interval, Tag,
 1587: 		       lists:delete(Pid, Lookupers));
 1588: 		_ ->
 1589:                     ?P("ctrl-loop-1: "
 1590:                        "received unexpected exit from ~p: "
 1591:                        "~n   ~p", [Pid, Reason]),
 1592: 		    ct:fail(?F("Unexpected exit from ~p", [Pid]))
 1593: 	    end
 1594: 
 1595:     after Interval ->
 1596:             ?P("ctrl-loop-1: "
 1597:                "timeout => (maybe) attempt control ~p when"
 1598:                "~n   Lookupers: ~p", [Op, Lookupers]),
 1599: 	    if Op =/= undefined ->
 1600: 		    ok = inet_gethost_native:control(Op);
 1601: 	       true ->
 1602: 		    ok
 1603: 	    end,
 1604: 	    Lookupers
 1605:     end.
 1606: 
 1607: lookup_loop(_, _Delay, Tag, _Parent,  0, _Hosts) ->
 1608:     ?P("lookup-loop: done with ~p", [Tag]),
 1609:     exit(Tag);
 1610: lookup_loop([], Delay, Tag, Parent, Cnt, Hosts) ->
 1611:     ?P("lookup-loop: begin lookup (~p) again when count = ~p", [Tag, Cnt]),
 1612:     lookup_loop(Hosts, Delay, Tag, Parent, Cnt, Hosts);
 1613: lookup_loop([H|Hs], Delay, Tag, Parent, Cnt, Hosts) ->
 1614:     ?P("lookup-loop: try lookup (~p, ~p) ~p", [Tag, Cnt, H]),
 1615:     case inet:gethostbyname(H) of
 1616: 	{ok, _Hent} ->
 1617:             ?P("lookup-loop: lookup => found"),
 1618:             ok;
 1619: 	{error, nxdomain} ->
 1620:             ?P("lookup-loop: lookup => nxdomain"),
 1621:             ok;
 1622: 	Error ->
 1623: 	    ?P("loopkup-loop: lookup => error for ~p: ~p", [H, Error]),
 1624: 	    Parent ! {Tag, self(), Error}
 1625:     end,
 1626:     receive
 1627:     after rand:uniform(Delay) ->
 1628: 	    lookup_loop(Hs, Delay, Tag, Parent, Cnt-1, Hosts) 
 1629:     end.
 1630: 
 1631: 
 1632: 
 1633: %% Test lookup with erroneously configured lookup option (OTP-12133).
 1634: lookup_bad_search_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1635:     %% Manipulation of resolver config is done in init_per_testcase
 1636:     %% and end_per_testcase to ensure cleanup.
 1637:     {ok,Hostname} = inet:gethostname(),
 1638:     {ok,_Hent} = inet:gethostbyname(Hostname), % Will hang loop for this bug
 1639:     ok.
 1640: 
 1641: 
 1642: 
 1643: %% Tests basic functionality of getiflist, getif, and ifget.
 1644: getif(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1645:     case os:type() of
 1646: 	{unix,Osname} ->
 1647: 	    do_getif(Osname, default),
 1648:             do_getif(Osname, inet),
 1649:             do_getif(Osname, socket);
 1650: 	{_,_} ->
 1651: 	    {skip,"inet:getif/0 probably not supported"}
 1652:     end.
 1653: 
 1654: inet_getiflist(default) ->
 1655:     inet:getiflist();
 1656: inet_getiflist(Backend) ->
 1657:     Func = getiflist,
 1658:     Fun  = fun() -> inet:Func([{inet_backend, Backend}]) end,
 1659:     backend_conditional_run(Backend, Func, Fun).
 1660: 
 1661: 
 1662: backend_conditional_run(default = Backend, Func, Fun)
 1663:   when is_atom(Func) andalso
 1664:        is_function(Fun, 0) ->
 1665:        io:format("try '~w' ~w~n", [Backend, Func]),
 1666:        Fun();
 1667: backend_conditional_run(Backend, Func, Fun)
 1668:   when ((Backend =:= inet) orelse (Backend =:= socket)) andalso
 1669:        is_atom(Func) andalso
 1670:        is_function(Fun, 0) ->
 1671:     try is_supported_backend(Backend) of
 1672:         true ->
 1673:             io:format("try '~w' ~w~n", [Backend, Func]),
 1674:             Fun();            
 1675:         false ->
 1676:             io:format("skip '~w' ~w: not supported~n", [Backend, Func]),
 1677:             throw({skip, {Func, Backend, notsup}})
 1678:     catch
 1679:         C:E:S ->
 1680:             %% Assume its because we run in a 'noesock' (or similar) system...
 1681:             io:format("skipping ~p: "
 1682:                       "~n   (Error) Class: ~p"
 1683:                       "~n   Error:         ~p"
 1684:                       "~n   Stack:         ~p"
 1685:                       "~n", [Backend, C, E, S]),
 1686:             throw({skip, {Func, Backend, C, E}})
 1687:     end.            
 1688: 
 1689: 
 1690: inet_ifget(default, Name, Opts) ->
 1691:     inet:ifget(Name, Opts);
 1692: inet_ifget(Backend, Name, Opts) ->
 1693:     Func = ifget,
 1694:     Fun  = fun() -> inet:Func(Name, [{inet_backend, Backend}|Opts]) end,
 1695:     backend_conditional_run(Backend, Func, Fun).
 1696: 
 1697: inet_getif(default) ->
 1698:     inet:getif();
 1699: inet_getif(Backend) ->
 1700:     Func = getif,
 1701:     Fun  = fun() -> inet:Func([{inet_backend, Backend}]) end,
 1702:     backend_conditional_run(Backend, Func, Fun).
 1703:     
 1704: 
 1705: do_getif(OsName, Backend) ->
 1706:     io:format("~w(~w) -> entry with"
 1707:               "~n   OsName:  ~p"
 1708:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, OsName]),
 1709:     try do_getif2(OsName, Backend) of
 1710:         ok ->
 1711:             io:format("~w(~w) -> success~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend]),
 1712:             ok
 1713:     catch
 1714:         throw:{skip, Reason} ->
 1715:             io:format("~w(~w) -> skipping: "
 1716:                       "~n   ~p"
 1717:                       "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Reason]),
 1718:             ok
 1719:     end.
 1720: 
 1721: do_getif2(OsName, Backend) ->
 1722:     io:format("~w(~w) -> entry with"
 1723:               "~n   OsName:  ~p"
 1724:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, OsName]),
 1725: 
 1726:     %% For this to work with the 'socket' backend, we need to verify 
 1727:     {ok, Hostname}   = inet:gethostname(),
 1728:     io:format("~w(~w) -> "
 1729:               "~n   Hostname: ~p"
 1730:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Hostname]),
 1731:     {ok, Address}    = inet:getaddr(Hostname,    inet),
 1732:     io:format("~w(~w) -> "
 1733:               "~n   Address: ~p"
 1734:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Address]),
 1735:     {ok, Loopback}   = inet:getaddr("localhost", inet),
 1736:     io:format("~w(~w) -> "
 1737:               "~n   Loopback: ~p"
 1738:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Loopback]),
 1739:     {ok, Interfaces} = inet_getiflist(Backend),
 1740:     io:format("~w(~w) -> "
 1741:               "~n   Interfaces: ~p"
 1742:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Interfaces]),
 1743:     HWAs =
 1744:         lists:sort(
 1745:           lists:foldl(
 1746:             fun (I, Acc) ->
 1747:                     case inet_ifget(Backend, I, [hwaddr]) of
 1748:                         {ok,[{hwaddr,A}]} -> [A|Acc];
 1749:                         {ok,[]} -> Acc
 1750:                     end
 1751:             end, [], Interfaces)),
 1752:     io:format("~w(~w) -> "
 1753:               "~n   HW Addrs:"
 1754:               "~n      ~p"
 1755:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, HWAs]),
 1756:     (OsName =/= sunos)
 1757:         andalso ((length(HWAs) > 0) orelse (ct:fail(no_HWAs))),
 1758:     Addresses =
 1759:         lists:sort(
 1760:           lists:foldl(
 1761:             fun(I, Acc) ->
 1762:                     case inet_ifget(Backend, I, [addr]) of
 1763:                         {ok, [{addr,A}]} -> [A|Acc];
 1764:                         {ok, []} -> Acc
 1765:                     end
 1766:             end, [], Interfaces)),
 1767:     io:format("~w(~w) -> ifget result: "
 1768:               "~n   Addresses: "
 1769:               "~n      ~p"
 1770:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Addresses]),
 1771:     {ok, Getif} = inet_getif(Backend),
 1772:     io:format("~w(~w) -> ifget verify: "
 1773:               "~n   Addresses: "
 1774:               "~n      ~p"
 1775:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Addresses]),
 1776:     Addresses = lists:sort([A || {A,_,_} <- Getif]),
 1777:     io:format("~w(~w) -> verify address"
 1778:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend]),
 1779:     true = ip_member(Address, Addresses),
 1780:     io:format("~w(~w) -> verify loopback"
 1781:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend]),
 1782:     true = ip_member(Loopback, Addresses),
 1783:     io:format("~w(~w) -> done~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend]),
 1784:     ok.
 1785: 
 1786: %% Test long interface names do not overrun buffer.
 1787: getif_ifr_name_overflow(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1788:     case os:type() of
 1789: 	{unix,Osname} ->
 1790: 	    do_getif_ifr_name_overflow(Osname);
 1791: 	{_,_} ->
 1792: 	    {skip,"inet:ifget/2 probably not supported"}
 1793:     end.
 1794: 
 1795: do_getif_ifr_name_overflow(_) ->
 1796:     %% emulator should not crash
 1797:     {ok,[]} = inet:ifget(lists:duplicate(128, "x"), [addr]),
 1798:     ok.
 1799: 
 1800: %% Test long service names do not overrun buffer.
 1801: getservbyname_overflow(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1802:     %% emulator should not crash
 1803:     {error,einval} = inet:getservbyname(list_to_atom(lists:flatten(lists:duplicate(128, "x"))), tcp),
 1804:     ok.
 1805: 
 1806: 
 1807: %% Test inet:gifaddrs/0.
 1808: getifaddrs(Config) when is_list (Config) ->
 1809:     do_getifaddrs(default),
 1810:     do_getifaddrs(inet),
 1811:     do_getifaddrs(socket),
 1812:     getifaddrs_verify_backends().
 1813: 
 1814: do_getifaddrs(Backend) ->
 1815:     try do_getifaddrs2(Backend) of
 1816:         ok ->
 1817:             io:format("~w(~w) -> success~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend]),
 1818:             ok
 1819:     catch
 1820:         throw:{skip, Reason} ->
 1821:             io:format("~w(~w) -> skipping: "
 1822:                       "~n   ~p"
 1823:                       "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Reason]),
 1824:             ok
 1825:     end.
 1826: 
 1827: 
 1828: do_getifaddrs2(default) ->
 1829:     io:format("try 'default' getifaddrs~n", []),
 1830:     do_getifaddrs3(inet:getifaddrs());
 1831: do_getifaddrs2(Backend) ->
 1832:     Func = getifaddrs,
 1833:     Fun  = fun() -> inet:Func([{inet_backend, Backend}]) end,
 1834:     do_getifaddrs3(backend_conditional_run(Backend, Func, Fun)).
 1835:     
 1836: 
 1837: is_supported_backend(inet = _Backend) ->
 1838:     true;
 1839: is_supported_backend(socket = _Backend) ->
 1840:     is_socket_supported().
 1841: 
 1842: is_socket_supported() ->
 1843:     try socket:info() of
 1844:         #{} ->
 1845:             true
 1846:     catch
 1847:         error : notsup ->
 1848:             false;
 1849:         error : undef ->
 1850:             false
 1851:     end.
 1852: 
 1853:     
 1854: do_getifaddrs3({ok, IfAddrs}) ->
 1855:     io:format("~w(ok) -> IfAddrs: "
 1856:               "~n   ~p"
 1857:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, IfAddrs]),
 1858:     case [If || {If,Opts} <- IfAddrs, lists:keymember(hwaddr, 1, Opts)] of
 1859:         [] ->
 1860:             case os:type() of
 1861:                 {unix,sunos} -> ok;
 1862:                 OT ->
 1863:                     ct:fail({should_have_hwaddr,OT})
 1864:             end;
 1865:         [_|_] -> ok
 1866:     end,
 1867:     Addrs = ifaddrs(IfAddrs),
 1868:     io:format("Addrs: "
 1869:               "~n   ~p"
 1870:               "~n", [Addrs]),
 1871:     [check_addr(Addr) || Addr <- Addrs],
 1872:     ok.
 1873: 
 1874: check_addr(Addr)
 1875:   when tuple_size(Addr) =:= 8,
 1876:        element(1, Addr) band 16#FFC0 =:= 16#FE80 ->
 1877:     io:format("Addr: ~p link local; SKIPPED!~n", [Addr]),
 1878:     ok;
 1879: check_addr({169, 254, 118, _} = Addr) ->
 1880:     io:format("Addr: ~p reserved (not usable); SKIPPED!~n", [Addr]),
 1881:     ok;
 1882: check_addr(Addr) ->
 1883:     io:format("Addr: ~p.~n", [Addr]),
 1884:     Ping = "ping",
 1885:     Pong = "pong",
 1886:     {ok,L} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{ip,Addr},{active,false}]),
 1887:     {ok,P} = inet:port(L),
 1888:     {ok,S1} = gen_tcp:connect(Addr, P, [{active,false}]),
 1889:     {ok,S2} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 1890:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S2, Ping),
 1891:     {ok,Ping} = gen_tcp:recv(S1, length(Ping)),
 1892:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S1, Pong),
 1893:     ok = gen_tcp:close(S1),
 1894:     {ok,Pong} = gen_tcp:recv(S2, length(Pong)),
 1895:     ok = gen_tcp:close(S2),
 1896:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L).
 1897: 
 1898: ifaddrs(IfOpts) ->
 1899:     ?P("~w(~w) -> entry with"
 1900:        "~n   IfOpts: ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, ?LINE, IfOpts]),
 1901:     IfMap = collect_ifopts(IfOpts),
 1902:     ChkFun =
 1903:         fun Self({{_,Flags} = Key, Opts}, ok) ->
 1904:                 Broadcast = lists:member(broadcast, Flags),
 1905:                 P2P = lists:member(pointtopoint, Flags),
 1906:                 case Opts of
 1907:                     [{addr,_},{netmask,_},{broadaddr,_}|Os]
 1908:                       when Broadcast ->
 1909:                         Self({Key, Os}, ok);
 1910:                     [{addr,_},{netmask,_},{dstaddr,_}|Os]
 1911:                       when P2P ->
 1912:                         Self({Key, Os}, ok);
 1913:                     [{addr,_},{netmask,_}|Os] ->
 1914:                         Self({Key, Os}, ok);
 1915:                     [{hwaddr,_}|Os] ->
 1916:                         Self({Key, Os}, ok);
 1917:                     [] ->
 1918:                         ok
 1919:                 end
 1920:         end,
 1921:     fold_ifopts(ChkFun, ok, IfMap),
 1922:     AddrsFun =
 1923:         fun ({{_,Flags}, Opts}, Acc) ->
 1924:                 case
 1925:                     lists:member(running, Flags)
 1926:                     andalso (not lists:member(pointtopoint, Flags))
 1927:                 of
 1928:                     true ->
 1929:                         lists:reverse(
 1930:                           [Addr || {addr,Addr} <- Opts],
 1931:                           Acc);
 1932:                     false ->
 1933:                         Acc
 1934:                 end
 1935:         end,
 1936:     fold_ifopts(AddrsFun, [], IfMap).
 1937: 
 1938: collect_ifopts(IfOpts) ->
 1939:     collect_ifopts(IfOpts, #{}).
 1940: %%
 1941: collect_ifopts(IfOpts, IfMap) ->
 1942:     ?P("~w(~w) -> entry with"
 1943:        "~n  IfMap: ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, ?LINE, IfMap]),
 1944:     case IfOpts of
 1945:         [{If,[{flags,Flags}|Opts]}|IfOs] ->
 1946:             ?P("~w(~w) -> found: "
 1947:                "~n  If:    ~p"
 1948:                "~n  Flags: ~p"
 1949:                "~n  Opts:  ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, ?LINE, If, Flags, Opts]),
 1950:             Key = {If,Flags},
 1951:             case maps:is_key(Key, IfMap) of
 1952:                 true ->
 1953:                     ct:fail({unexpected_ifopts,IfOpts,IfMap});
 1954:                 false ->
 1955:                     collect_ifopts(IfOs, IfMap, Opts, Key, [])
 1956:             end;
 1957:         [] ->
 1958:             IfMap;
 1959:         _ ->
 1960:             ?P("~w(~w) -> invalid: "
 1961:                "~n  IfOpts: ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, ?LINE, IfOpts]),
 1962:             ct:fail({unexpected_ifopts, IfOpts, IfMap})
 1963:     end.
 1964: %%
 1965: collect_ifopts(IfOpts, IfMap, Opts, Key, R) ->
 1966:     case Opts of
 1967:         [{flags,_}|_] ->
 1968:             {If,_} = Key,
 1969:             collect_ifopts(
 1970:               [{If,Opts}|IfOpts], maps:put(Key, lists:reverse(R), IfMap));
 1971:         [OptVal|Os] ->
 1972:             collect_ifopts(IfOpts, IfMap, Os, Key, [OptVal|R]);
 1973:         [] ->
 1974:             collect_ifopts(IfOpts, maps:put(Key, lists:reverse(R), IfMap))
 1975:     end.
 1976: 
 1977: fold_ifopts(Fun, Acc, IfMap) ->
 1978:     fold_ifopts(Fun, Acc, IfMap, maps:keys(IfMap)).
 1979: %%
 1980: fold_ifopts(Fun, Acc, IfMap, Keys) ->
 1981:     case Keys of
 1982:         [Key|Ks] ->
 1983:             Opts = maps:get(Key, IfMap),
 1984:             fold_ifopts(Fun, Fun({Key,Opts}, Acc), IfMap, Ks);
 1985:         [] ->
 1986:             Acc
 1987:     end.
 1988: 
 1989: 
 1990: getifaddrs_verify_backends() ->
 1991:     io:format("maybe attempt verify backends~n", []),
 1992:     try is_supported_backend(inet) of
 1993:         true ->
 1994:             try is_supported_backend(socket) of
 1995:                 true ->
 1996:                     getifaddrs_verify_backends(
 1997:                       inet:getifaddrs([{inet_backend, inet}]),
 1998:                       inet:getifaddrs([{inet_backend, socket}]));
 1999:                 false ->
 2000:                     io:format("'socket' backend not supported: skip~n", [])
 2001:             catch
 2002:                 SC:SE:SS ->
 2003:                     io:format("skipping ~p: "
 2004:                               "~n   (Error) Class: ~p"
 2005:                               "~n   Error:         ~p"
 2006:                               "~n   Stack:         ~p"
 2007:                               "~n", [socket, SC, SE, SS]),
 2008:                     ok
 2009:             end;
 2010:         false ->
 2011:             io:format("'inet' backend not supported: skip~n", [])
 2012:     catch
 2013:         IC:IE:IS ->
 2014:             io:format("skipping ~p: "
 2015:                       "~n   (Error) Class: ~p"
 2016:                       "~n   Error:         ~p"
 2017:                       "~n   Stack:         ~p"
 2018:                       "~n", [inet, IC, IE, IS]),
 2019:             ok
 2020:     end.
 2021: 
 2022: getifaddrs_verify_backends({ok, IfAddrs},
 2023:                            {ok, IfAddrs}) ->
 2024:     io:format("IfAddrs are equal: "
 2025:               "~n   ~p"
 2026:               "~n", [IfAddrs]),
 2027:     ok;
 2028: getifaddrs_verify_backends({ok, IfAddrs_INET},
 2029:                            {ok, IfAddrs_SOCKET}) ->
 2030:     io:format("IfAddrs are not *identical* - check what differs: "
 2031:               "~n   INET:"
 2032:               "~n      ~p"
 2033:               "~n   SOCKET:"
 2034:               "~n      ~p"
 2035:               "~n   INET -- SOCKET: "
 2036:               "~n      ~p"
 2037:               "~n   SOCKET -- INET: "
 2038:               "~n      ~p"
 2039:               "~n", [IfAddrs_INET, IfAddrs_SOCKET,
 2040:                      IfAddrs_INET -- IfAddrs_SOCKET,
 2041:                      IfAddrs_SOCKET -- IfAddrs_INET]),
 2042:     getifaddrs_verify_backends2(IfAddrs_INET, IfAddrs_SOCKET).
 2043: 
 2044: getifaddrs_verify_backends2(INET, SOCKET) ->
 2045:     getifaddrs_verify_backends3(lists:keysort(1, INET),
 2046:                                 lists:keysort(1, SOCKET)).
 2047: 
 2048: getifaddrs_verify_backends3([] = _INET, [] = _SOCKET) ->
 2049:     ok;
 2050: getifaddrs_verify_backends3([] = _INET, SOCKET) ->
 2051:     io:format("'socket' backend contains extra interfaces: "
 2052:               "~n   ~p"
 2053:               "~n", [SOCKET]),
 2054:     ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal);
 2055: getifaddrs_verify_backends3(INET, [] = _SOCKET) ->
 2056:     io:format("'inet' backend contains extra interfaces: "
 2057:               "~n   ~p"
 2058:               "~n", [INET]),
 2059:     ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal);
 2060: getifaddrs_verify_backends3([{IF, INFO}|INET],
 2061:                             [{IF, INFO}|SOCKET]) ->
 2062:     io:format("backend(s) identical for ~p~n", [IF]),
 2063:     getifaddrs_verify_backends3(INET, SOCKET);
 2064: getifaddrs_verify_backends3([{IF, I_INFO}|INET],
 2065:                             [{IF, S_INFO}|SOCKET]) ->
 2066:     io:format("backend(s) not *identical* for ~p~n", [IF]),
 2067:     getifaddrs_verify_backend(IF, I_INFO, S_INFO),
 2068:     getifaddrs_verify_backends3(INET, SOCKET);
 2069: getifaddrs_verify_backends3([{I_IF, _}|_], [{S_IF, _}|_]) ->
 2070:     io:format("not equal interfaces"
 2071:               "~n   ~p"
 2072:               "~n   ~p"
 2073:               "~n", [I_IF, S_IF]),
 2074:     ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal).
 2075: 
 2076: 
 2077: %% On windows the info may be in different order
 2078: %% (inet and net versions) because the information
 2079: %% comes from several sources. And the processing
 2080: %% is different on inet and net.
 2081: %% The info allways starts with 'flags' and ends with
 2082: %% 'hwaddr'. So deal with those two first and the rest
 2083: %% can compared after.
 2084: 
 2085: %% getifaddrs_verify_backend(IF,
 2086: %%                           [],
 2087: %%                           []) ->
 2088: %%     io:format("done => "
 2089: %%               "~n   backend(s) equal (enough) for ~p~n", [IF]),
 2090: %%     ok;
 2091: %% getifaddrs_verify_backend(IF,
 2092: %%                           [{flags, Flags}, {hwaddr, HwAddr}],
 2093: %%                           [{flags, Flags}, {hwaddr, HwAddr}]) ->
 2094: %%     io:format("done when hwaddr (and flags) equal => "
 2095: %%               "~n   backend(s) equal (enough) for ~p~n", [IF]),
 2096: %%     ok;
 2097: %% getifaddrs_verify_backend(IF,
 2098: %%                           [{flags, []}, {hwaddr, HwAddr}],
 2099: %%                           [{flags, Flags}, {hwaddr, HwAddr}])
 2100: %%   when (Flags =/= []) ->
 2101: %%     io:format("done when hwaddr (inet flags empty and socket flags non-empty) "
 2102: %%               "equal enough => "
 2103: %%               "~n   backend(s) equal (enough) for ~p~n", [IF]),
 2104: %%     ok;
 2105: %% getifaddrs_verify_backend(IF,
 2106: %%                           [{flags, []}, {hwaddr, HwAddr}],
 2107: %%                           [{hwaddr, HwAddr}]) ->
 2108: %%     io:format("done when hwaddr (inet flags empty and no socket flags) "
 2109: %%               "equal => "
 2110: %%               "~n   backend(s) equal (enough) for ~p~n", [IF]),
 2111: %%     ok;
 2112: %% getifaddrs_verify_backend(IF,
 2113: %%                           [{hwaddr, HwAddr}],
 2114: %%                           [{hwaddr, HwAddr}]) ->
 2115: %%     io:format("done when hwaddr equal => "
 2116: %%               "~n   backend(s) equal (enough) for ~p~n", [IF]),
 2117: %%     ok;
 2118: 
 2119: %% getifaddrs_verify_backend(IF,
 2120: %%                           [{flags, Flags} | I_Info],
 2121: %%                           [{flags, Flags} | S_Info]) ->
 2122: %%     io:format("flags are equal for ~p => continue~n", [IF]),
 2123: %%     getifaddrs_verify_backend(IF, I_Info, S_Info);
 2124: 
 2125: %% getifaddrs_verify_backend(
 2126: %%   IF,
 2127: %%   [{addr, Addr}, {netmask, Mask}, {broadaddr, BAddr} | I_Info],
 2128: %%   [{addr, Addr}, {netmask, Mask}, {broadaddr, BAddr} | S_Info]) ->
 2129: %%     io:format("addr, netmask and bradcast addr equal for ~p => contunue: "
 2130: %%               "~n   Addr:  ~p"
 2131: %%               "~n   Mask:  ~p"
 2132: %%               "~n   BAddr: ~p"
 2133: %%               "~n", [IF, Addr, Mask, BAddr]),
 2134: %%     getifaddrs_verify_backend(IF, I_Info, S_Info);
 2135: %% getifaddrs_verify_backend(
 2136: %%   IF,
 2137: %%   [{addr, Addr}, {netmask, Mask}, {broadaddr, BAddr} | I_Info],
 2138: %%   S_Info0) ->
 2139: %%     io:format("addr, netmask and bradcast addr equal for ~p => contunue: "
 2140: %%               "~n   Addr:  ~p"
 2141: %%               "~n   Mask:  ~p"
 2142: %%               "~n   BAddr: ~p"
 2143: %%               "~n", [IF, Addr, Mask, BAddr]),
 2144: %%     getifaddrs_verify_backend(IF, I_Info, S_Info);
 2145: 
 2146: getifaddrs_verify_backend(IF, I_INFO, S_INFO) ->
 2147:     {I_Rest1, S_Rest1} =
 2148:         case {I_INFO, S_INFO} of
 2149:             {[{flags, I_FLAGS}|IR1], [{flags, S_FLAGS}|SR1]} ->
 2150:                 case {I_FLAGS -- S_FLAGS, S_FLAGS -- I_FLAGS} of
 2151:                     {[], []} ->
 2152:                         io:format("flags for ~p *are* equal~n", [IF]),
 2153:                         {IR1, SR1};
 2154:                     {[], [multicast]} ->
 2155:                         io:format("flags for ~p are *not* equal - "
 2156:                                   "extra flag 'multicast': "
 2157:                                   "~n   INET:   ~p"
 2158:                                   "~n   SOCKET: ~p"
 2159:                                   "~n", [IF, I_FLAGS, S_FLAGS]),
 2160:                         case lists:member(loopback, I_FLAGS) of
 2161:                             true ->
 2162:                                 %% The net module getifaddrs contains
 2163:                                 %% some more flags...
 2164:                                 %% Happens on windows
 2165:                                 io:format("flags for ~p *acceptably* "
 2166:                                           "different~n", [IF]),
 2167:                                 {IR1, SR1};
 2168:                             _ ->
 2169:                                 ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal)
 2170:                         end;
 2171:                     {[], [running]} ->
 2172:                         io:format("flags for ~p are *not* equal - "
 2173:                                   "extra flag 'running': "
 2174:                                   "~n   INET:   ~p"
 2175:                                   "~n   SOCKET: ~p"
 2176:                                   "~n", [IF, I_FLAGS, S_FLAGS]),
 2177:                         case lists:member(up, I_FLAGS) of
 2178:                             true ->
 2179:                                 %% The net module getifaddrs contains
 2180:                                 %% some more flags...
 2181:                                 %% Happens on windows
 2182:                                 io:format("flags for ~p *acceptably* "
 2183:                                           "different~n", [IF]),
 2184:                                 {IR1, SR1};
 2185:                             _ ->
 2186:                                 ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal)
 2187:                         end;
 2188:                     {IRem, SRem} ->
 2189:                         io:format("flags for ~p are *not* equal - check flags: "
 2190:                                   "~n   INET:   ~p"
 2191:                                   "~n   SOCKET: ~p"
 2192:                                   "~n   INET -- SOCKET: ~p"
 2193:                                   "~n   SOCKET -- INET: ~p"
 2194:                                   "~n", [IF, I_FLAGS, S_FLAGS, IRem, SRem]),
 2195:                         ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal)
 2196:                 end;
 2197:             _ ->
 2198:                 io:format("flags for ~p missing for one or both backends: "
 2199:                           "~n   INET:   ~p"
 2200:                           "~n   SOCKET: ~p"
 2201:                           "~n", [IF, I_INFO, S_INFO]),
 2202:                 ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal)
 2203:         end,
 2204:     {I_Rest2, S_Rest2} =
 2205:         case {lists:reverse(I_Rest1), lists:reverse(S_Rest1)} of
 2206:             {[{hwaddr, HWADDR}, {flags, I_Flags2}|IR2],
 2207:              [{hwaddr, HWADDR}, {flags, S_Flags2}|SR2]}
 2208:               when I_Flags2 =:= S_Flags2 ->
 2209:                 io:format("hwaddr for ~p *is* equal (and flags are also equal)~n",
 2210:                           [IF]),
 2211:                 {lists:reverse(IR2), lists:reverse(SR2)};
 2212:             {[{hwaddr, HWADDR}, {flags, I_Flags2}|_IR2],
 2213:              [{hwaddr, HWADDR}, {flags, S_Flags2}|_SR2]}
 2214:               when I_Flags2 =/= S_Flags2 ->
 2215:                 io:format("hwaddr for ~p *is* equal"
 2216:                           "~n   But flags not equal: "
 2217:                           "~n      Inet Flags: ~p"
 2218:                           "~n      Sock Flags: ~p"
 2219:                           "~n",
 2220:                           [IF, I_Flags2, S_Flags2]),
 2221:                 ct:fail(ifaddrs_equal_but_flags_are_not);
 2222:             {[{hwaddr, HWADDR}, {flags, []}|IR2], [{hwaddr, HWADDR}|SR2]} ->
 2223:                 io:format("hwaddr for ~p *is* equal "
 2224:                           "(empty flags on inet - ignore)~n", [IF]),
 2225:                 {lists:reverse(IR2), lists:reverse(SR2)};
 2226:             {[{hwaddr, HWADDR}|IR2], [{hwaddr, HWADDR}|SR2]} ->
 2227:                 io:format("hwaddr for ~p *is* equal~n", [IF]),
 2228:                 {lists:reverse(IR2), lists:reverse(SR2)};
 2229:             {[{hwaddr, I_HWADDR}|_IR2], [{hwaddr, S_HWADDR}|_SR2]} ->
 2230:                 io:format("hwaddr for ~p *not* equal:"
 2231:                           "~n   INET:   ~p"
 2232:                           "~n   SOCKET: ~p"
 2233:                           "~n", [IF, I_HWADDR, S_HWADDR]),
 2234:                 ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal);
 2235:             {IR2, [{hwaddr, HWADDR}|SR2]} ->
 2236:                 io:format("hwaddr for ~p only for socket - accept: "
 2237:                           "~n   ~p"
 2238:                           "~n", [IF, HWADDR]),
 2239:                 {lists:reverse(IR2), lists:reverse(SR2)};
 2240:             {[{hwaddr, HWADDR}|_IR2], _SR2} ->
 2241:                 io:format("hwaddr for ~p only for inet - fail: "
 2242:                           "~n   ~p"
 2243:                           "~n", [IF, HWADDR]),
 2244:                 ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal);
 2245:             _ ->
 2246:                 io:format("hwaddr for ~p missing for both backends - accept~n",
 2247:                           [IF]),
 2248:                 {I_Rest1, S_Rest1}
 2249:         end,
 2250:     case {I_Rest2 -- S_Rest2, S_Rest2 -- I_Rest2} of
 2251:         {[], []} ->
 2252:             io:format("remaining info for ~p is equal~n", [IF]),
 2253:             ok;
 2254:         {I_Diff, S_Diff} ->
 2255:             io:format("remaining info for ~p not equal: "
 2256:                       "~n   INET:           ~p"
 2257:                       "~n   SOCKET:         ~p"
 2258:                       "~n   INET -- SOCKET: ~p"
 2259:                       "~n   SOCKET -- INET: ~p"
 2260:                       "~n", [IF, I_Rest2, S_Rest2, I_Diff, S_Diff]),
 2261:             %% Check if its a link local address, then ignore...
 2262:             %% This is "a bit" loosey-goosey...
 2263:             case lists:keysearch(addr, 1, S_Rest2) of
 2264:                 {value, {addr, {169, 254, _, _}}} ->
 2265:                     io:format("link local address for ~p - accept~n", [IF]),
 2266:                     ok;
 2267:                 _ ->
 2268:                     ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal)
 2269:             end
 2270:     end.
 2271: 
 2272: 
 2273: %% Works just like lists:member/2, except that any {127,_,_,_} tuple
 2274: %% matches any other {127,_,_,_}. We do this to handle Linux systems
 2275: %% that use (for instance) 127.0.1.1 as the IP address for the hostname.
 2276: 
 2277: ip_member({127,_,_,_}, [{127,_,_,_}|_]) -> true;
 2278: ip_member(K, [K|_]) -> true;
 2279: ip_member(K, [_|T]) -> ip_member(K, T);
 2280: ip_member(_, []) -> false.
 2281: 
 2282: %% Case fold to upper case according to RFC 4343
 2283: %%
 2284: toupper([C|Cs]) when is_integer(C) ->
 2285:     if  $a =< C, C =< $z ->
 2286: 	    [(C - $a + $A)|toupper(Cs)];
 2287: 	true ->
 2288: 	    [C|toupper(Cs)]
 2289:     end;
 2290: toupper([]) ->
 2291:     [].
 2292: 
 2293: 
 2294: simple_netns(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2295:     {ok,U} = gen_udp:open(0),
 2296:     case inet:setopts(U, [{netns,""}]) of
 2297: 	ok ->
 2298: 	    jog_netns_opt(U),
 2299: 	    ok = gen_udp:close(U),
 2300: 	    %%
 2301: 	    {ok,L} = gen_tcp:listen(0, []),
 2302: 	    jog_netns_opt(L),
 2303: 	    ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
 2304: 	    %%
 2305: 	    case gen_sctp:open() of
 2306: 		{ok,S} ->
 2307: 		    jog_netns_opt(S),
 2308: 		    ok = gen_sctp:close(S);
 2309: 		{error,eprotonosupport} ->
 2310: 		    ok
 2311: 	    end;
 2312: 	{error,einval} ->
 2313: 	    {skip,"setns() not supported"}
 2314:     end.
 2315: 
 2316: jog_netns_opt(S) ->
 2317:     %% This is just jogging the option mechanics
 2318:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{netns,""}]),
 2319:     {ok,[{netns,""}]} = inet:getopts(S, [netns]),
 2320:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{netns,"/proc/self/ns/net"}]),
 2321:     {ok,[{netns,"/proc/self/ns/net"}]} = inet:getopts(S, [netns]),
 2322:     ok.
 2323: 
 2324: 
 2325: %% Smoke test netns support.
 2326: simple_netns_open(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2327:     %% Note: {error,enoent} will be returned if the run-time executable
 2328:     %%       has support for netns, but /proc/self/ns/net is missing.
 2329:     case gen_udp:open(0, [binary,{netns,"/"},inet]) of
 2330: 	{ok,U} ->
 2331: 	    ok = gen_udp:close(U);
 2332: 	{error,E1} when E1 =:= einval; E1 =:= eperm; E1 =:= enoent ->
 2333: 	    ok
 2334:     end,
 2335:     case gen_tcp:listen(0, [binary,{netns,"/"},inet]) of
 2336: 	{ok,T} ->
 2337: 	    ok = gen_tcp:close(T);
 2338: 	{error,E2} when E2 =:= einval; E2 =:= eperm; E2 =:= enoent ->
 2339: 	    ok
 2340:     end,
 2341:     try gen_sctp:open(0, [binary,{netns,"/"},inet]) of
 2342: 	{ok,S} ->
 2343: 	    ok = gen_sctp:close(S);
 2344: 	{error,E3}
 2345: 	  when E3 =:= einval; E3 =:= eperm;
 2346: 	       E3 =:= enoent; E3 =:= eprotonosupport ->
 2347: 	    ok
 2348:     catch
 2349: 	error:badarg ->
 2350: 	    %% Some older platforms does not allow netns for sctp
 2351: 	    ok
 2352:     end.
 2353: 
 2354: 
 2355: %% Manual test to be run outside test_server in an emulator
 2356: %% started by root, in a machine with setns() support...
 2357: test_netns() ->
 2358:     DefaultIF = v1,
 2359:     DefaultIP = {192,168,1,17},
 2360:     Namespace = "test",
 2361:     NamespaceIF = v2,
 2362:     NamespaceIP = {192,168,1,18},
 2363:     %%
 2364:     DefaultIPString = inet_parse:ntoa(DefaultIP),
 2365:     NamespaceIPString = inet_parse:ntoa(NamespaceIP),
 2366:     cmd("ip netns add ~s",
 2367: 	[Namespace]),
 2368:     cmd("ip link add name ~w type veth peer name ~w netns ~s",
 2369:         [DefaultIF,NamespaceIF,Namespace]),
 2370:     cmd("ip netns exec ~s ip addr add ~s/30 dev ~w",
 2371: 	[Namespace,NamespaceIPString,NamespaceIF]),
 2372:     cmd("ip netns exec ~s ip link set ~w up",
 2373: 	[Namespace,NamespaceIF]),
 2374:     cmd("ip addr add ~s/30 dev ~w",
 2375: 	[DefaultIPString,DefaultIF]),
 2376:     cmd("ip link set ~w up",
 2377: 	[DefaultIF]),
 2378:     try test_netns(
 2379: 	  {DefaultIF,DefaultIP},
 2380: 	  filename:join("/var/run/netns/", Namespace),
 2381: 	  {NamespaceIF,NamespaceIP}) of
 2382: 	Result ->
 2383: 	    io:put_chars(["#### Test done",io_lib:nl()]),
 2384: 	    Result
 2385:     after
 2386: 	cmd("ip link delete ~w type veth",
 2387: 	    [DefaultIF]),
 2388: 	cmd("ip netns delete ~s",
 2389: 	    [Namespace])
 2390:     end.
 2391: 
 2392: test_netns({DefaultIF,DefaultIP}, Namespace, {NamespaceIF,NamespaceIP}) ->
 2393:     {ok,ListenSocket} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
 2394:     {ok,[{addr,DefaultIP}]} = inet:ifget(ListenSocket, DefaultIF, [addr]),
 2395:     {ok,ListenPort} = inet:port(ListenSocket),
 2396:     {ok,ConnectSocket} =
 2397: 	gen_tcp:connect(
 2398: 	  DefaultIP, ListenPort, [{active,false},{netns,Namespace}], 3000),
 2399:     {ok,[{addr,NamespaceIP}]} = inet:ifget(ConnectSocket, NamespaceIF, [addr]),
 2400:     {ok,ConnectPort} = inet:port(ConnectSocket),
 2401:     {ok,AcceptSocket} = gen_tcp:accept(ListenSocket, 0),
 2402:     {ok,AcceptPort} = inet:port(AcceptSocket),
 2403:     {ok,{NamespaceIP,ConnectPort}} = inet:peername(AcceptSocket),
 2404:     {ok,{DefaultIP,AcceptPort}} = inet:peername(ConnectSocket),
 2405:     ok = gen_tcp:send(ConnectSocket, "data"),
 2406:     ok = gen_tcp:close(ConnectSocket),
 2407:     {ok,"data"} = gen_tcp:recv(AcceptSocket, 4, 1000),
 2408:     {error,closed} = gen_tcp:recv(AcceptSocket, 1, 1000),
 2409:     ok = gen_tcp:close(AcceptSocket),
 2410:     ok = gen_tcp:close(ListenSocket).
 2411: 
 2412: cmd(Cmd, Args) ->
 2413:     cmd(io_lib:format(Cmd, Args)).
 2414: %%
 2415: cmd(CmdString) ->
 2416:     io:put_chars(["# ",CmdString,io_lib:nl()]),
 2417:     io:put_chars([os:cmd(CmdString++" ; echo '  =>' $?")]),
 2418:     ok.
 2419: 
 2420: -define(CAP_NET_RAW, 13).        %% from /usr/include/linux/capability.h
 2421: 
 2422: can_bind_to_device({unix, linux}, {Major, _, _})
 2423:   when Major > 2 ->
 2424:     Status = os:cmd("cat /proc/self/status | grep CapEff"),
 2425:     [_, CapEffStr] = string:tokens(Status, [$\n, $\t]),
 2426:     CapEff = list_to_integer(CapEffStr, 16),
 2427:     if CapEff band (1 bsl ?CAP_NET_RAW) =/= 0 ->
 2428:             ok;
 2429:        true ->
 2430:             {skip,"insufficient capabilities, CAP_NET_RAW not granted"}
 2431:     end;
 2432: can_bind_to_device(_OS, _Version) ->
 2433:     {skip,"socket option bind_to_device not supported on this OS or version"}.
 2434: 
 2435: simple_bind_to_device(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2436:     case can_bind_to_device(os:type(), os:version()) of
 2437:         ok ->
 2438:             {ok,U} = gen_udp:open(0),
 2439:             jog_bind_to_device_opt(U),
 2440:             ok = gen_udp:close(U),
 2441:             %%
 2442:             {ok,L} = gen_tcp:listen(0, []),
 2443:             jog_bind_to_device_opt(L),
 2444:             ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
 2445:             %%
 2446:             case gen_sctp:open() of
 2447:                 {ok,S} ->
 2448:                     jog_bind_to_device_opt(S),
 2449:                     ok = gen_sctp:close(S);
 2450:                 {error,eprotonosupport} ->
 2451:                     ok
 2452:             end;
 2453:         Other ->
 2454:             Other
 2455:     end.
 2456: 
 2457: %% Smoke test bind_to_device support.
 2458: simple_bind_to_device_open(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2459:     case can_bind_to_device(os:type(), os:version()) of
 2460:         ok ->
 2461:             {ok,U} = gen_udp:open(0, [binary,{bind_to_device,<<"lo">>},inet]),
 2462:             ok = gen_udp:close(U),
 2463:             {ok,T} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [binary,{bind_to_device,<<"lo">>},inet]),
 2464:             ok = gen_tcp:close(T),
 2465: 
 2466:             case gen_sctp:open(0, [binary,{bind_to_device,<<"lo">>},inet]) of
 2467:                 {ok,S} ->
 2468:                     ok = gen_sctp:close(S);
 2469:                 {error,eprotonosupport} ->
 2470:                     ok
 2471:             end;
 2472:         Other ->
 2473:             Other
 2474:     end.
 2475: 
 2476: jog_bind_to_device_opt(S) ->
 2477:     %% This is just jogging the option mechanics
 2478:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{bind_to_device,<<>>}]),
 2479:     {ok,[{bind_to_device,<<>>}]} = inet:getopts(S, [bind_to_device]),
 2480:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{bind_to_device,<<"lo">>}]),
 2481:     {ok,[{bind_to_device,<<"lo">>}]} = inet:getopts(S, [bind_to_device]),
 2482:     ok.
 2483: 
 2484: add_del_host(_Config) ->
 2485:     Name = "foo.com",
 2486:     Alias = "bar.org",
 2487:     Ip = {69,89,31,226},
 2488:     HostEnt = #hostent{
 2489:         h_name = Name,
 2490:         h_aliases = [Alias],
 2491:         h_addrtype = inet,
 2492:         h_length = 4,
 2493:         h_addr_list = [Ip]
 2494:     },
 2495:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet),
 2496:     ok = inet_db:add_host(Ip, [Name, Alias]),
 2497:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet),
 2498:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Alias, inet),
 2499:     ok = inet_db:del_host(Ip),
 2500:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet),
 2501:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Alias, inet),
 2502:     ok = inet_db:add_host(Ip, [Name, Alias]),
 2503:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet).
 2504: 
 2505: add_del_host_v6(_Config) ->
 2506:     Name = "foo.com",
 2507:     Alias = "bar.org",
 2508:     Ip = {32,1,219,8,10,11,18,240},
 2509:     HostEnt = #hostent{
 2510:         h_name = Name,
 2511:         h_aliases = [Alias],
 2512:         h_addrtype = inet6,
 2513:         h_length = 16,
 2514:         h_addr_list = [Ip]
 2515:     },
 2516:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet6),
 2517:     ok = inet_db:add_host(Ip, [Name, Alias]),
 2518:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet6),
 2519:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Alias, inet6),
 2520:     ok = inet_db:del_host(Ip),
 2521:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet6),
 2522:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Alias, inet6),
 2523:     ok = inet_db:add_host(Ip, [Name, Alias]),
 2524:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet6).
 2525:

 2527: 
 2528: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2529: 
 2530: %%% This is a supremely simple test case.
 2531: %%% It basically just tests that the function (inet:socknames/1,2)
 2532: %%% returns with the expected result (a list of addresses, which in
 2533: %%% the case of tcp and udp should be exactly one address long).
 2534: 
 2535: socknames_sctp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2536:     %%% ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_socknames_sctp(Config) end).
 2537:     {skip, not_implemented_yet}.
 2538: 
 2539: 
 2540: socknames_tcp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2541:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 2542:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 2543:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 2544:                             Addr;
 2545:                         {error, Reason} ->
 2546:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 2547:                     end
 2548:            end,
 2549:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socknames_tcp0(Config, Addr) end,
 2550:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 2551:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 2552: 
 2553: do_socknames_tcp0(_Config, Addr) ->
 2554:     %% Begin with the plain old boring (= port) socket(s)
 2555:     ?P("Test socknames for 'old' socket (=port)"),
 2556:     do_socknames_tcp1([], Addr),
 2557: 
 2558:     %% And *maybe* also check the 'new' shiny socket sockets
 2559:     try socket:info() of
 2560:         #{} ->
 2561:             ?P("Test socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)"),
 2562:             do_socknames_tcp1([{inet_backend, socket}], Addr)
 2563:     catch
 2564:         error:notsup ->
 2565:             ?P("Skip test of socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)"),
 2566:             ok;
 2567:         error:undef:ST ->
 2568:             case ST of
 2569:                 [{prim_socket,info,[],_}|_] ->
 2570:                     ?P("Skip test of socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)")
 2571:             end
 2572:     end.
 2573: 
 2574: 
 2575: do_socknames_tcp1(Conf, Addr) ->
 2576:     %% For socket on windows, we require binding...
 2577:     ?P("try to bind to ~p", [Addr]),
 2578:     BaseOpts = [{ip, Addr}],
 2579: 
 2580:     ?P("try create listen socket"),
 2581:     {ok, S1} = gen_tcp:listen(0, Conf ++ BaseOpts),
 2582:     ?P("try get socknames for (listen) socket: "
 2583:        "~n      ~p", [S1]),
 2584:     PortNumber1 = case inet:socknames(S1) of
 2585: 		      {ok, [{_Addr1, PortNo1}]} ->
 2586: 			  PortNo1;
 2587: 		      {ok, Addrs1} ->
 2588:                           ?P("failed socknames: unexpected number of addresses"
 2589:                              "~n      ~p", [Addrs1]),
 2590: 			  exit({unexpected_addrs_length, length(Addrs1)});
 2591: 		      {error, Reason1} ->
 2592:                           ?P("failed socknames: error"
 2593:                              "~n      ~p", [Reason1]),
 2594: 			  exit({skip, {listen_socket, Reason1}})
 2595: 		  end,
 2596:     ?P("try connect to listen socket on port ~p", [PortNumber1]),
 2597:     {ok, S2} = gen_tcp:connect(Addr, PortNumber1, Conf ++ BaseOpts),
 2598:     ?P("try get socknames for (connected) socket: "
 2599:        "~n      ~p", [S2]),
 2600:     case inet:socknames(S2) of
 2601: 	{ok, [_Addr2]} ->
 2602: 	    ok;
 2603: 	{ok, Addrs2} ->
 2604:             ?P("failed socknames: unexpected number of addresses"
 2605:                "~n      ~p", [Addrs2]),
 2606: 	    exit({unexpected_addrs_length, length(Addrs2)});
 2607: 	{error, Reason2} ->
 2608:             ?P("failed socknames: error"
 2609:                "~n      ~p", [Reason2]),
 2610: 	    exit({skip, {connected_socket, Reason2}})
 2611:     end,
 2612:     ?P("try accept connection"),
 2613:     {ok, S3} = gen_tcp:accept(S1),
 2614:     ?P("try get socknames for (accepted) socket: "
 2615:        "~n      ~p", [S3]),
 2616:     case inet:socknames(S3) of
 2617: 	{ok, [_Addr3]} ->
 2618: 	    ok;
 2619: 	{ok, Addrs3} ->
 2620:             ?P("failed socknames: unexpected number of addresses"
 2621:                "~n      ~p", [Addrs3]),
 2622: 	    exit({unexpected_addrs_length, length(Addrs3)});
 2623: 	{error, Reason3} ->
 2624:             ?P("failed socknames: error"
 2625:                "~n      ~p", [Reason3]),
 2626: 	    exit({skip, {accepted_socket, Reason3}})
 2627:     end,
 2628:     ?P("close socket(s)"),
 2629:     (catch gen_tcp:close(S3)),
 2630:     (catch gen_tcp:close(S2)),
 2631:     (catch gen_tcp:close(S1)),
 2632:     ?P("done"),
 2633:     ok.
 2634: 
 2635: 
 2636: socknames_udp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2637:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 2638:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 2639:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 2640:                             Addr;
 2641:                         {error, Reason} ->
 2642:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 2643:                     end
 2644:            end,
 2645:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socknames_udp0(Config, Addr) end,
 2646:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 2647:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 2648: 
 2649: do_socknames_udp0(_Config, Addr) ->
 2650:     %% Begin with a the plain old boring (= port) socket(s)
 2651:     ?P("Test socknames for 'old' socket (=port)"),
 2652:     do_socknames_udp1([], Addr),
 2653: 
 2654:     %% And *maybe* also check the 'new' shiny socket sockets
 2655:     try socket:info() of
 2656:         #{} ->
 2657:             ?P("Test socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)"),
 2658:             do_socknames_udp1([{inet_backend, socket}], Addr)
 2659:     catch
 2660:         error : notsup ->
 2661:             ?P("Skip test of socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)"),
 2662:             ok;
 2663:         error:undef:ST ->
 2664:             case ST of
 2665:                 [{prim_socket,info,[],_}|_] ->
 2666:                     ?P("Skip test of socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)")
 2667:             end
 2668:     end.
 2669: 
 2670: 
 2671: do_socknames_udp1(Conf, Addr) ->
 2672:     %% For socket on windows, we require binding...
 2673:     ?P("try to bind to ~p", [Addr]),
 2674:     BaseOpts = [{ip, Addr}],
 2675: 
 2676:     ?P("try create socket"),
 2677:     {ok, S1} = gen_udp:open(0, Conf ++ BaseOpts),
 2678:     ?P("try get socknames for socket: "
 2679:        "~n      ~p", [S1]),
 2680:     case inet:socknames(S1) of
 2681:         {ok, [_Addr1]} ->
 2682:             ok;
 2683:         {ok, Addrs1} ->
 2684:             ?P("failed socknames: unexpected number of addresses"
 2685:                "~n      ~p", [Addrs1]),
 2686:             exit({unexpected_addrs_length, length(Addrs1)});
 2687:         {error, Reason1} ->
 2688:             ?P("failed socknames: error"
 2689:                "~n      ~p", [Reason1]),
 2690:             exit({skip, {listen_socket, Reason1}})
 2691:     end,
 2692:     ?P("enable debug"),
 2693:     inet:setopts(S1, [{debug, true}]),
 2694:     ?P("close socket"),
 2695:     (catch gen_udp:close(S1)),
 2696:     ?P("done"),
 2697:     ok.
 2698:

 2702: 
 2703: links() ->
 2704:     pi(links).
 2705: 
 2706: monitors() ->
 2707:     pi(monitors).
 2708: 
 2709: pi(Item) ->
 2710:     {Item, Val} = process_info(self(), Item),
 2711:     Val.
 2712:     
 2713:
